noun.description: Mythology (The name of) a powerful and terrible god or demon, associated with hell or the underworld.
A person who or thing which is likened to Demogorgon, especially in having absolute power or supremacy.

origin: Mid 16th century; earliest use found in David Lindsay (c1486–1555), writer and herald. From post-classical Latin Demogorgon, scribal error in scholia on Statius Thebaid 4. 516 for demiurgon, accusative of demiurgos.
